snippet: The former chief pilot for Malaysia Airlines said he is convinced that human intervention was to blame for the disappearance of the plane, but he said he had no reason to believe the captain did it.
abstract: Search for Malaysian Airlines flight 370 has turned up no sign of plane, and some investigators say only logical theory for disappearance is human intervention, most likely by pilot Zaharie Ahmad Shah or co-pilot Fariq Abdul Hamid.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe reported from Kuala Lumpur, and Keith Bradsher from Canberra, Australia. Michelle Innis contributed reporting from Sydney, Australia, and Nicola Clark from Paris. Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The former chief pilot for Malaysia Airlines said he is convinced that human intervention was to blame for the disappearance of the plane, but he said he had no reason to believe the captain did it.

headline.main: To Explain Missing Malaysia Airlines Flight, ‘Rogue Pilot’ Seems Likeliest Theory
headline.print_headline: ‘Rogue Pilot’ Emerges as Main Theory in Loss of Malaysian Plane
